decision.summary: The knowledge graph extraction is valid in structure and referential integrity but contains BLOCKER-level violations of mandatory edge constraints requiring immediate correction: two edges directly connect validation/prototype nodes to intervention nodes, which violates the explicit requirement that all paths flow through intermediate concept nodes. Additionally, multiple required fields are missing (node_rationale, edge_rationale, intervention_lifecycle_rationale, intervention_maturity_rationale) per the specified output format. The extracted fabric captures the core reasoning path from fragmented know-how risks through formal methods design to DSS prototype deployment, but misses important intermediate theoretical insights about modularity and scalability that bridge validation evidence to the proposed global model intervention. After applying the proposed fixes including edge deletions, field additions, and new intermediate nodes, the extraction will be valid, complete, and mergeable across data sources.

schema_check.issue: Several nodes missing 'node_rationale' field which is listed in output format specification
schema_check.suggestion: Add 'node_rationale' field to all nodes with 'closest preceding data source section title reference' as specified in output format

schema_check.issue: Edges missing 'edge_rationale' field explicitly required in output format specification
schema_check.suggestion: Add 'edge_rationale' field to all edges with 'connection justification with closest preceding data source section title reference'

schema_check.issue: Intervention nodes missing required rationale fields: intervention_lifecycle_rationale and intervention_maturity_rationale
schema_check.suggestion: Add 'intervention_lifecycle_rationale' and 'intervention_maturity_rationale' to all intervention nodes

names: edge from 'Prototype DSS optimizes machining parameters using 47 know-how examples' targets 'Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how' - violates mandatory constraint that risk/validation evidence nodes cannot directly connect to intervention nodes without intermediate concept nodes

edge from 'Modular DSS prototype demonstrates integration of knowledge capture tools on PC platform' targets 'Develop modular DSS tools for capturing and applying manufacturing know-how' - violates mandatory constraint

rationale_mismatches.issue: Intervention node 'Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how' has intervention_lifecycle=1 (Model Design) but this is a design/deployment stage intervention, not model design
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SECTION 5: 'a fund of domain information (knowledge) as a global model...unified core for decision support systems' and SECTION 5 'The latest possible if...0 0 G Α Α⊆ and 1 1 G Α Α⊆' discusses implementation/deployment, not model design
rationale_mismatches.fix: Change intervention_lifecycle to 5 (Deployment) as it concerns building and maintaining a live shared system

rationale_mismatches.issue: Intervention node 'Integrate empirical know-how via higher-order logic formalization into DSS knowledge base' missing edge_confidence_rationale in edge connecting it
rationale_mismatches.evidence: SECTION 6: 'A variety of know-how has been collected from Japanese manufacturers in this study...47 examples of know-how treated of end milling have been analyzed'
rationale_mismatches.fix: Add edge_confidence_rationale documenting that formalization is validated by the 47 end-milling examples

change_node_fields.node_name: Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how
change_node_fields.reason: MAJOR: Current value 1 (Model Design) incorrect. This intervention concerns deployment and maintenance of a live shared system. SECTION 5: 'establish computer-aided support for decision-making technologies...to create a unified information space' discusses ongoing deployment and modification phase, not initial model design.

change_node_fields.node_name: Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how
change_node_fields.json_new_value: Lifecycle stage 5 (Deployment) because the intervention describes establishing and maintaining a live shared system accessible over Internet. SECTION 5: 'while the model n G Μ is modified as necessary, a DSS can utilize a part of the domain information' indicates ongoing operational deployment.
change_node_fields.reason: MINOR: Missing required field per output format specification

change_node_fields.node_name: Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how
change_node_fields.reason: MAJOR: Current value 2 is too high. SECTION 6: 'establishing an associated domain information space through the Internet would make this problem manageable' frames this as a hypothetical future direction, not yet even at proof-of-concept stage. Should be 1 (Foundational/Theoretical).

change_node_fields.node_name: Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how
change_node_fields.json_new_value: Maturity 1 (Foundational/Theoretical) - the paper proposes the Internet-based global model as a future research direction, not as something implemented or tested. SECTION 6: 'We suppose, that establishing an associated domain information space through the Internet would make this problem manageable' indicates speculative/theoretical proposal.
change_node_fields.reason: MINOR: Missing required field per output format specification

nodes.name: Construct internet-accessible global domain model for CIM to centralize know-how
nodes.description: Design and publish a shared, continually updated algebraic model of CIM tasks, scales and ontologies reachable over the Internet.

nodes.name: Develop modular DSS tools for capturing and applying manufacturing know-how
nodes.description: Implement and refine the Scale System Builder, Ontology Builder, Fact Master and Validation modules for practitioners.

nodes.name: Integrate empirical know-how via higher-order logic formalization into DSS knowledge base
nodes.description: Translate large bodies of empirical rules (e.g. tool tables) into algebraic predicates callable by the DSS.
aliases: formalise empirical tables in HO logic

nodes.name: Deploy prototype DSS to optimize end-mill machining parameters using forward chaining reasoning
nodes.description: Field-test the validated prototype within manufacturing workflows for tool-life or time optimisation.

nodes.name: Loss of human experiential knowledge in CIM decision-making
nodes.description: Critical manufacturing decisions fail to use the large body of accumulated human experience, leading to sub-optimal outcomes.
aliases: loss of human know-how in manufacturing
erosion of experiential knowledge in CIM

nodes.name: Inconsistent integration of decision support systems in CIM environment
nodes.description: Existing DSS, expert and retrieval systems do not integrate cleanly, reducing reliability and maintainability.

nodes.name: Inefficient utilization of empirical know-how in manufacturing decision-making
nodes.description: Large volumes of empirical rules (tables, graphs) exist but are difficult to apply systematically in software.
aliases: poor exploitation of experimental manufacturing rules

nodes.name: Fragmented storage of professional know-how across manufacturers
nodes.description: Know-how is siloed in separate organisations, preventing systematic capture.

nodes.name: Absence of unified domain model in CIM
nodes.description: Without a shared formal model, heterogeneous applications cannot interoperate.
aliases: lack of common CIM information model

nodes.name: High granularity of empirical know-how complicating integration
nodes.description: Experimental tables/graphs are voluminous and detailed, making direct incorporation costly.

nodes.name: Mapping professional tasks onto unified information structure enables integration
nodes.description: If each professional task is represented within a common formal structure, diverse decision methods can coexist.

nodes.name: Representing empirical know-how in higher-order logic algebras enables scalable use
nodes.description: Encoding empirical tables/graphs as elements of multi-sorted algebras allows automated reasoning and combination.

nodes.name: Use formal multi-sorted algebra and higher-order logic to model domain knowledge
nodes.description: Applying a rigorous mathematical formalism gives integrity, reliability and compatibility for DSS.

nodes.name: Accumulate domain knowledge in global model accessible via Internet
nodes.description: Storing the evolving model online supports continuous updates and shared access.

nodes.name: Domain model with scale system and ontology represented in algebras
nodes.description: Implements the formalism via scale definitions and ontology primitives mapped to algebra carriers.

nodes.name: Modular DSS environment with Scale System Builder, Ontology Builder, Fact Master and Validation modules
nodes.description: Software suite providing construction, verification and maintenance of the global model.

nodes.name: Forward chaining reasoning in prototype DSS for machining parameter optimization
nodes.description: Reasoner applies encoded rules to optimise either tool life or operation time.
aliases: forward chaining engine for machining DSS

nodes.name: Prototype DSS optimizes machining parameters using 47 know-how examples
nodes.description: Experimental system produced correct recommendations for tool life/time criteria from 47 empirical rules.

nodes.name: Modular DSS prototype demonstrates integration of knowledge capture tools on PC platform
nodes.description: Demonstrates functional coupling of Scale System Builder, Ontology Builder and reasoning engine.

notes: BLOCKER: Edge from 'Prototype DSS optimizes machining parameters using 47 know-how examples' (validation evidence) directly to 'Construct internet-accessible global domain model' (intervention) violates mandatory rule 'risk and intervention nodes are only allowed to connect with intermediate nodes but never with each other' - requires insertion of theoretical insight and design rationale nodes

BLOCKER: Edge from 'Modular DSS prototype demonstrates integration of knowledge capture tools' (validation evidence) directly to 'Develop modular DSS tools' (intervention) violates same mandatory constraint - requires intermediate nodes

MAJOR: Intervention lifecycle incorrect for 'Construct internet-accessible global domain model' - set to 1 (Model Design) when should be 5 (Deployment) per SECTION 5 discussion of 'modified as necessary' ongoing system

MAJOR: Intervention maturity incorrect for global model intervention - set to 2 (Experimental) when should be 1 (Foundational/Theoretical) per SECTION 6 'We suppose, that establishing...would make this problem manageable' indicating speculative proposal
MINOR: All nodes missing 'node_rationale' field required by output specification - must add with citations to 'closest preceding data source section title'
MINOR: All edges missing 'edge_rationale' field required by output specification - must add with connection justification and citations
MINOR: All intervention nodes missing 'intervention_lifecycle_rationale' and 'intervention_maturity_rationale' fields required by specification

COVERAGE: Extraction misses critical intermediate theoretical insight 'Scale system and ontology modularity enables distributed updates' that bridges validation evidence to global model design rationale
COVERAGE: Extraction misses validation evidence node 'Modular architecture scalability demonstrates feasibility of global domain model' needed to justify scaling from prototype to global system
ACCURACY: Edge confidence levels appropriate but lack detailed rationale citations - fixed in proposed changes

STRUCTURE: Core reasoning path correctly flows Risk → Problem Analysis → Theoretical Insight → Design Rationale → Implementation → Validation, but missing intermediate nodes break path to final interventions
CONSISTENCY: Node naming follows granularity rules appropriately - specific enough for standalone understanding and merging across sources
